page.title: 08THE MILL AT ELMSWELL
page.content: In Elmswell there is a mill, and one day I went to see how it works. The mill makes animal feed for the local farmers, from British wheat, barley and oats, and maize from the U.S.A. which arrives at the docks at Ipswich, Colchester, Yarmouth and London. When stores come in they are put in bulk storage bins. Then when it is time to mill, the right amount is weighed out on automatic scales. Then it is put into one of the two hammer mills. Then it goes to the ring roll press to be pelleted. When the pellets come out they are cooled, then they are put in big containers and put on lorries to be taken to the farms. The mill is powered by electricity. It used to be powered by oil. Three men work full time (47 hours) and one works part time.
